title: Nation A's absolute advantage in chairs

content.prompt: Nations A and B produce only chairs and bicycles. If each laborer in Nation A can produce twice as many chairs as each laborer in Nation B, then which of the following is necessarily true?

choices.label: Nation A has a comparative advantage in chairs.
Nation A has a comparative advantage in bicycles.
Nation A has an absolute advantage in chairs.
Nation B has an absolute advantage in bicycles.
Nation A should specialize in producing chairs.

topic.text: 1.3: Comparative Advantage and Gains from Trade
